definitions.example: If you put the brakes on too hard, the wheels will lock.
Remember to lock the door when you leave.

definitions.definition: To be capable of becoming fastened in place.
definitions.example: This door locks with a key.
We locked arms and stepped out into the night.

definitions.definition: (break dancing) To freeze one's body or a part thereof in place.
To raise or lower (a boat) in a lock.
To seize (e.g. the sword arm of an antagonist) by turning the left arm around it, to disarm him.
To modify (a thread) so that users cannot make new posts in it.
(WMF jargon) To prevent a page from being edited by other users.
definitions.example: Frequently vandalized pages are generally locked to prevent further damage.

definitions.definition: Having undergone locking; secured by a lock.
definitions.example: A locked door barred the way.

definitions.definition: (of a phone) Bound to a carrier.
